講義時に毎回レポート課題を提示します。15回の講義を5回ずつ3部に分けて、そこから1課題を選択することにより、順次3回のレポート提出を求めます。Moodle上の提出パケットを利用してください。字数は各回2000字から3000字までを原則とします(英文の場合は、500語から750語まで)。  Three assignments must be submitted. In each lesson, one assignment will be suggested. The first assignment is chosen from the first five lessons and submitted within a week; the second is chosen from the next five and submitted within a week; and the last assignment is chosen from the final five lessons and submitted within a week. As a general rule, the number of characters is 2000-3000 per assignment, or, for an assignment written in English, 500-750 words. Each of the three assignments is submitted through Moodle.

n.c: To display an ability to summarize the main points of each week's readings in a logical, coherent, and comprehensive fashion.  Student must write a 1-2 page summary for each in-class reading, highlighting the author's main points and outlining your own opinion in favor of or against the author's thesis using quotes from the article to support your position. The same will be required of the 15 out-of-class articles you are required to read each week.  The instructor will explain.

As this is a discussion class, the ability to speak in class and attend every class is required. Every reading will be assigned to 2-3 student "Experts" who will be responsible for leading the discussion for that article. Simply re-reading the article to the class will not be prized highly. You must be able to walk us through the author's main points and point out quotes in the article that support your position. YOU MUST ATTEND EVERY CLASS. Being absent on your "expert" day, not being prepared for class, not having completed the reading, or failing to bring your materials to class will be penalized.

Student must write a 1-2 page summary for each in-class reading, highlighting the author's main points and outlining your own opinion in favor of or against the author's thesis using quotes from the article to support your position. The same will be required of the 15 out-of-class articles you are required to read each week.  The instructor will explain.

As this is a discussion class, the ability to speak in class and attend every class is required. Every reading will be assigned to 2-3 student "Experts" who will be responsible for leading the discussion for that article. Simply re-reading the article to the class will not be prized highly. You must be able to walk us through the author's main points and point out quotes in the article that support your position. YOU MUST ATTEND EVERY CLASS. Mid-term Essay and Final Essay / Presentation

Conversation work in groups: in each class there will be a selection of questions related to the topics used to help group work and vocabulary consolidation.  Quizzes covering required vocabulary are part of class work although study for this may well be covered in homework.

Homework largely consists of writing a weekly summary or alternatively writing and extended answer to one of the in-class conversation questions. Mid-term and Final essays will be based on these summaries.  In each essay one of the themes covered in class will need to be developed preferably with some particular opinion or point of view argued  for ( not just 'merits and demerits'). MLA format used - we will cover this in class. Essays are to be on different subjects to presentation subject. Essays are evaluated on your ability to argue and support the particular point of view that you have developed.

q: ゲーム理論:中級・基礎科目

n.c: Your understanding of the class materials is tested.

Homeworks  Purpose: review what we learn in the class and provide practice in applying concepts learned in class. You can’t learn without practice.    • Doing homeworks is important for getting good scores on the exams.  • Work in groups of 3 or 4 coming to understand the problems.  • Write up your answers individually. This should ensure you understand your answers.  • The homeworks should be considered as sample questions for the exams.

Participation in class discussion is critical. This does not require that you stun your classmates with insight. Sharing relevant experiences is very valuable. Clarification questions are also highly valued (if it’s not clear to you, chances are it’s not clear to others). Good class participation involves (i) arriving on time, (ii) remaining seated until class is over, and (iii) remaining quiet and attentive unless contributing to class discussion.

q: 経済理論:中級・基礎科目

n.c: Final Exam: It may consist of short-answer questions and multiple choice questions.

Peer-review policy essays: In each of your essay, you will evaluate the argument and/or assessment discussed in a policy commentary, using the concepts, theoretical models, and/or empirical findings discussed in the class. In doing so, you are expected to identify the underlying causal mechanism(s) of the policy issue, and either discuss policy implications or offer policy recommendations.  Each essay is at least three-page long, double-spaced but should not exceed five pages.  We adopt a peer-review system, whereby each of your essays will be evaluated by two of your fellow students in class.  Please note that submitting an essay alone does not complete your essay assignment; you will also evaluate two essays by other students as a reviewer.  You will receive the score of zero (0) for your essay unless you provide two reviews for the essay assignment.  Your first and second essays are counted towards 10% and 20% of your final grade
Attendance and active participation are presumed; the failure to attend and participate in weekly lectures will result in an "F" (failure).

• Pre-Break Presentations: You are expected to make up to two presentations in class before the winter break (i.e., October-December) in the group you will be randomly assigned to. In each of pre-break presentations, you task is to demonstrate your understanding of basic theory of why war occurs, how domestic politics affects diplomacy, how deterrence works, or why states sign on alliance treaties. The topics and length of your group presentations will be determined by the instructor and subject to change. Your first and second presentations are counted towards 10% and 20%, respectively, of your final grade,   • Post-Break Presentation: You will also make another group presentation in January in a different group. Your January presentation will be based on your policy essay. The group allocations will be determined by the instructor based on the topic(s) you address for your essays. This presentation will be counted towards 25% of your final grades.

Students are required to submit their own plans for writing MA thesis based upon the content of the textbook. Students are required to make presentation of their own research plans at the final session. It is compulsory that students should satisfy the three criteria in your research plan paper: 1) the theme is in full originality;  2) the topic must be based upon critically breakthrough the previous works on the similar topics with your utterly new viewpoint; 3) whether or not you mention the available documents (for instance, FRUS, British Foreign Office archives etc.) to examine your research topic within a limited time.
Students are expected to prepare for their own view on the assigned part of the text by writing a short essay at each session.

Do you attend class, and are you actively attending?  Do you participate in the co-creation?  It doesn't matter if your ideas appear in the final creation or who talks the most, but rather whether you are stepping out the role of passive observer.    If you are uncomfortable speaking in groups, there are still opportunities to actively create.  Write a proposal / summary in advance and email it to everyone.  Though this course can also serve as an opportunity for you to grow -- maybe you can try exploring different strategies to learn more about why you are uncomfortable speaking in groups, in line with the growth mindset for the course.
The final project may play a role in evaluation, but as it's a co-creative exercise, it's more about how you tried to contribute to the final project, and not the final project itself.

p: 大学で学問をするために

n.c: 期末レポートからなります。その主要な評価基準は、1講義内容をどの程度正確に理解できているか、2どの程度説得力のある論述ができているか、3その上でどの程度自分の意見を説得的に述べられているのかの3点からなります。    ※次の「平常点評価」と併せた上で、全体の評価方法は次の通りです。  C:リアクション・ペーパー・期末試験共に、講義内容を概ね理解できている。  B:リアクション・ペーパー・期末試験共に、講義内容を相当正確に理解している。  A:リアクション・ペーパー・期末試験共に、講義内容を深く理解・消化し、記述も優れている。  A+:講義内容を深く理解・消化した上で、関連文献を効果的に引用しつつ独創性のある主張を行っている。
各回リアクションペーパーを課します。その際に、1各回の講義の内容を正確に理解しているか、2その上で積極的な議論ができているか、という角度からリアクションペーパーでの議論を判断します。

p: 大学で学問をするために

n.c: 中間小テスト部32%、期末テスト部33%(2022年度実績)。今年度は、それぞれ、この±10%以内の予定。例年、両テストは持込不可(例外:紙のノート類および紙の書籍類)として実施しています。ただし、今年度の扱いは授業時に提示します。いずれのテストも受けなかった場合は「不受験」として報告されます 。
試験を予定通り実施する場合、レポートは行いません。教員がなんらかの事情で試験を実施しなかった場合は、それを代替するレポートあるいはそれに相当する課題を実施します。
25--35%の予定。授業への参加態度、予復習用小テスト及び小論などを考慮します。試験配分割合が変動した場合は、それに応じて平常点割合も変動させます。予復習用小テスト及び小論は、出席した上で受けることによって得点とします。出席のみで得点になることはありませんし、予復習用小テスト及び小論のみで得点になることもありません。
0--10%の予定。ワセポチが授業で導入された場合の学生の利用状況や、レビューシートなど、上記以外のなんらかの学習活動に、それぞれわずかずつ得点を与える場合があります。

n.c: GRADING  Grading and evaluation will be based on attitude, attendance and performance on writing assignments. Story ideas, accuracy, creativity and reporting technique will be valued. Story assignments will be evaluated on a point basis. All these factors will contribute to the final grade.

-ASSIGNMENTS  This course will involve two take-home assignments that will be graded and then critiqued in class.     The first assignment will ask students to write a so-called “pitch” for an overseas story of their choice. The goal is to write a convincing story proposal that would convince an editor to hire you and send you to cover the story. You will have to plan your travel and interview schedule and questions. You will have to list the people you want to talk with and give a clear outline of what you hope the story will say. You will also have to consider what multimedia approaches are appropriate.    The second assignment will involve writing a story from a set of given quotes and facts. Your instructor will provide a list of background, quotes and characters relating to a real news event. Your objective will be selecting the most relevant and riveting points, while ignoring immaterial items, to create a tightly woven and readable story.

-ATTENDANCE  Attendance is mandatory. Treat this class as a job. Not showing up to work is unprofessional, and so is blowing off class. Class participation and attitude are essential elements of your final assessment. So make sure you score points here by taking the easy step of attending class. It’s not that hard. I can make exceptions for personal of family emergencies. But not for things like routine medical appointments, job obligations, meetings with friends, etc.
-ATTITUDE and CLASS PARTICIPATION
